meanings.definition: To forbid or prevent something from happening.
meanings.sent1: The teacher is prohibiting students from using their phones in class.
meanings.sent2: The sign on the door prohibits smoking inside the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat kept prohibiting the dog from entering the room.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain was prohibiting us from going outside for a walk.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules are prohibiting any form of cheating during the exam.

meanings.definition: To make something illegal or against the rules.
meanings.sent1: The new law is prohibiting the sale of alcohol to minors.
meanings.sent2: The company policy prohibits employees from sharing confidential information.
meanings.sent3: The silly clown was prohibiting anyone from frowning at the party.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds were prohibiting the sun from shining through.
meanings.sent5: The security guard is prohibiting unauthorized access to the building.
